timeline.message: Add gradle property to skip generateRestModel task (#362)

Implement support for always projecting fields by name. (#358)

* Release 29.4.7
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:srikrish-19/rest.li into master
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:srikrish-19/rest.li into master
darkcluster - identical traffic multiplier: Adding the formula for avg # of dark requests
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:srikrish-19/rest.li into master
Adding ability to let users determine if a request should be dispatched to dark clusters
Adding dark cluster response validation metrics
Update changelog for dark cluster response validation metrics

timeline.bodyText: The documentation in rest.li should be generic, because this is open source. So, for instance, instead of "It will be a combination of hostname and instanceId" say something like "For example, it can be a combination of the hostname and an instance identifier".
timeline.author: davidhoa

timeline.bodyText: move this to the api package and directory.
timeline.author: davidhoa

timeline.bodyText: can you try to add an argument to the rewriteRequest to add the header(s)? Otherwise we are producing intermediate garbage by creating the request and then throwing it away after copying it to create another request.
timeline.author: davidhoa

timeline.bodyText:
this is good, but lets also add a sentence saying why this is a useful feature to have. Something like:
"This allows response comparison metrics about a dark cluster to be displayed (via a monitoring/graphing system) with all other system metrics in a dark cluster host. These response comparison metrics are not specific to this dark cluster host, but that should be sufficient for most cases, and further granularity can be achieved by having separate dark clusters.
timeline.author: davidhoa
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+package com.linkedin.darkcluster.api;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * Collector of incoming response validation metrics from dispatchers.
+ * This is meant to be called on the dark cluster hosts where the request headers containing response validation metrics are read.
+ * A dark cluster host may receive metrics from multiple dispatchers and this interface defines method for collecting these
+ * incoming metrics.

timeline.bodyText: check for null in the constructor. If null,  have a no-op/default implementation, so you don't need to check for null later. or, if appropriate, add the Nonnull annotations.
timeline.author: davidhoa

timeline.bodyText: same here, maybe add Nonnull annotation?
timeline.author: davidhoa
davidhoa
davidhoa
